landlord_tenant_relationship.reasoning: Adequately alleged. Complaint states Plaintiff is a tenant at 45 Maple Street, Defendant is the owner/landlord of that same premises, and plaintiff pays monthly rent ($1,200) (see ¶¶1.1, 1.2, 3.1). These facts establish the landlord–tenant relationship.

act_or_omission_by_landlord.reasoning: Adequately alleged. Complaint alleges Defendant was notified of the hot‑water failure, told Plaintiff he ordered a replacement part, but failed to restore hot water over the relevant period (see ¶¶3.2–3.6, 3.8). This is an omission/failure to repair within the landlord's control.

substantial_interference.reasoning: Adequately alleged. Complaint alleges an extended (≈3 week) loss of an essential service (hot water) and factual effects: inability to take hot showers, inability to safely bathe an infant, paying for gym membership and gas, and using Plaintiff's mother's home for bathing (see ¶¶3.6–3.7). Those facts plausibly plead a material/substantial interference with use and enjoyment.

causation.reasoning: Adequately alleged. Complaint links Defendant's conduct/omission (failure to obtain/replace the part and restore hot water after notice) to the resulting loss of hot water and the injuries/expenses claimed (see ¶¶3.2–3.6, 3.8–3.9, 4.4). It alleges the landlord had control over the repair, giving rise to proximate causation.

damages.reasoning: Adequately alleged. Complaint identifies out‑of‑pocket expenses and consequential losses (gym fees, gas, other expenses and an estimated damage amount of at least $400) and requests compensatory damages (see ¶¶3.7, 3.9, 5.1).
